content.question:
Object
Impact velocity
Rebound velocity

Puck <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>

<math alttext="positive 1.0 meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="negative 0.5 meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>-</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

Puck <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="positive 4.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="negative 3.5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>-</mo><mn>3.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

Puck <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>

<math alttext="positive 2.5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="negative 1.5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>-</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

Three identical pucks slide along a horizontal sheet of ice, strike a wall, and rebound. The initial velocity before impact and the rebound velocity immediately after the collision are indicated in the table. Which of the following correctly compares the amount of kinetic energy lost, <math alttext="delta K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>K</mi></mstyle></math>, of the three pucks during the collisions?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, delta K sub 1 equals delta K sub 2, close parenthesis, is greater than delta K sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="delta K sub 3 is greater than, open parenthesis, delta K sub 1 equals delta K sub 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="delta K sub 2 is greater than delta K sub 3, which is greater than delta K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta K sub 3 is greater than delta K sub 2, which is greater than delta K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta K sub 3 is greater than delta K sub 2, which is greater than delta K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
